name: PatternLab
description: PatternLab MODX: an experiment to combine the atomic design philosophy with MODX templating structure.
author: Hugo Peek

tvs.caption: Call to action (CTA)
tvs.name: header_cta
tvs.description: Select the CTA you want to show in the header of this page. You can create CTA's under Content > Global Content > Call To Actions.

tvs.caption: Availability
tvs.name: cta_availability
tvs.description: Where would you like to be able to place this CTA?
tvs.inputOptionValues: In page header==header||In sidebar (on detail pages)==sidebar||In the content (through CB)==content||Below the content==footer

tvs.caption: Email address recipient
tvs.name: fb_email_to
tvs.description: Submitted forms will be sent to this address. If this field is empty, the form will be sent to the default email address of the website (which can be found under Extras > Configuration).

tvs.caption: Email CC address
tvs.name: fb_email_cc
tvs.description: Optional.

tvs.caption: Email BCC address
tvs.name: fb_email_bcc
tvs.description: Optional.

tvs.caption: Email FROM address
tvs.name: fb_email_from
tvs.description: Optional. Defaults to emailsender system setting.

tvs.caption: Email FROM name
tvs.name: fb_email_from_name
tvs.description: Optional. Defaults to site_name system setting.

tvs.caption: Redirect page
tvs.name: fb_redirect_id
tvs.description: Enter the ID of the page, or drag the page from the menu tree to this input field.

tvs.caption: Text in submit button
tvs.name: fb_submit_button
tvs.description: Defaults to Send.

tvs.caption: Layout type
tvs.name: fb_form_layout
tvs.description: Stacked means the labels are always above the input fields, Horizontal means the labels are next to the fields, Inline means everything is on 1 row (so only for very small forms).

tvs.caption: Email template
tvs.name: fb_email_template
tvs.description: Optional. Name of the chunk containing your own customized (HTML) email template. Make sure there is a [[+content]] placeholder in there for listing the fields.

tvs.caption: Email template rows
tvs.name: fb_email_template_rows
tvs.description: Optional. Name of the chunk containing the customized HTML for the template rows. This will be used to display each individual field in your email. Use [[+label]] and [[+value]] placeholders to show the content.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_toggle
tvs.description: IMPORTANT! For the autoresponder to know which email address to use, the Input (Email) field needs to be present in the form.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder FROM address
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_from
tvs.description: Optional. This is the address where the messages appear to be sent from. Can be a non-existing address, like noreply@yourdomain.com. Defaults to emailsender system setting.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder FROM name
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_from_name
tvs.description: Optional. This is the name that will (probably) be visible in the recipients' inbox. Defaults to site_name system setting.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder REPLY TO address
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_reply_to
tvs.description: Optional. This address will be used when recipient replies to this message directly. Defaults to respectively the client_email and emailsender system setting.

tvs.caption: Autoresponse message
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_message
tvs.description: The content of the email that will be sent. You can use placeholders here from the form fields you used. Just use the syntax [[+fb123-field-name]], so complete with prefix and correct name of the input field.

tvs.caption: Global background images
tvs.name: global_background_img
tvs.description: These backgrounds can be applied to CB layouts (under their Settings wheel) and possibly to other elements too.

tvs.caption: Background
tvs.name: header_background
tvs.description: Select a background for this header. You can create these backgrounds under Content > Global Content > Backgrounds.

tvs.caption: Main title
tvs.name: header_title
tvs.description: This will be displayed in the header section below the main menu. The title will be inherited on child pages, but can also be overwritten by entering something new.

tvs.caption: Subtitle
tvs.name: header_subtitle
tvs.description: This will be displayed under the main title. Also inherited and overwritable on child pages.

tvs.caption: Image (Landscape)
tvs.name: overview_img_landscape
tvs.description: This is the default overview image, in a regular 4:3 aspect ratio.

tvs.caption: Image (Portrait)
tvs.name: overview_img_portrait
tvs.description: This is a standing image in 3:4 aspect ratio, best suited for floating left or right of content.

tvs.caption: Image (Square)
tvs.name: overview_img_square
tvs.description: This is an image in 1:1 aspect ratio, for use in cards, avatars or circular images.

tvs.caption: Image (Wide)
tvs.name: overview_img_wide
tvs.description: This is an image with widescreen proportions, in 16:9 aspect ratio.

tvs.caption: Image (Panorama)
tvs.name: overview_img_pano
tvs.description: This is an image with 21:9 aspect ratio, for use in headers or layout backgrounds.

tvs.caption: Image priority
tvs.name: overview_img_priority
tvs.description: With this setting, you can indicate which image type you prefer if the system has a choice.

tvs.caption: Icon (SVG)
tvs.name: overview_icon_svg
tvs.description: This can be pretty much anything, but please make sure the SVG has a square aspect ratio.

tvs.caption: Icon (Font)
tvs.name: overview_icon_font
tvs.description: Select an icon of the icon font that's being used in this project. Check the styleguide for available classes, or use the autocomplete search as you type.

tvs.caption: Link / button text
tvs.name: overview_link_text
tvs.description: When filled in, this value will override the button text defined in the Overview ContentBlock. Remember that if no button text is set in Overview CB, no button will be shown!

tvs.caption: Project hub timeline
tvs.name: project_hub_timeline
tvs.description: In this timeline you can keep track of the projects' progress and see what's coming up next. You can also link to all related project files and resources from here, so you can find them back more easily.

tvs.caption: Author
tvs.name: article_author
tvs.description: Select the author of this article. He or she must be a MODX user.
tvs.inputOptionValues: @SELECT '' AS username, '' AS id UNION ALL ( SELECT username, id FROM `modx_users` ORDER BY username )

tvs.caption: Comments
tvs.name: article_comments
tvs.description: Enable or disable comments for this article.

snippets.name: stripAsAlias
snippets.description: Output modifier that turns input into lowercase-hyphen-separated format and strips unwanted special characters.

snippets.name: stripWords
snippets.description: Opposed to stripString, which only allows you to strip a single value, stripWords lets you enter multiple (comma separated) values.

snippets.name: getChildCount
snippets.description: Returns the amount of child pages a resource has.

snippets.name: getCrosslinks
snippets.description: Returns the ID's of all resources that link to a given resource through a TV.

snippets.name: resourceTVInputOptions
snippets.description: Generates input option values that can be used in TV's, for creating resource selectors.

snippets.name: resourceMediaPath
snippets.description: Standalone version of a MIGX snippet that can generate subfolders in media sources.

snippets.name: jsonGetValue
snippets.description: Get the value of a specific key from a JSON string.

snippets.name: setBoxType
snippets.description: Output the necessary class names for overview items, based on their template.

snippets.name: iconInputOptions
snippets.description: Generates input options with all Semantic UI icon classes.

snippets.name: sliderLoadAssets
snippets.description: Load CSS and JS dependencies for Slick slider through CDN.

snippets.name: tabsGenerateNav
snippets.description: Generates the navigation buttons needed by the Tabs CB.
